intro: Diabelia serrata, commonly known as the serrated diabelia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its stems are often woody and can have a somewhat succulent appearance. Diabelia serrata is typically found in dry, open habitats and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
